page.title: 15BADLUARACH CHILDREN-SCHOOL
page.content: IN THE 1930s THE CHILDREN AT BADLUARACH WALKED 3 MILES TO GET TO THEIR SCHOOL. IT WAS A ROUGH TRACK AND THERE WERE LOTS OF THINGS TO DISTRACT THEM SUCH AS COLLECTING NUTS OR PLAYING IN PUDDLES. THERE WERE 30 CHILDREN IN BADCAUL SCHOOL.CHILDREN WOULD COME FROM AS FAR AWAY AS CAMUSNAGAUL. THERE WERE SIDE SCHOOLS AT DUNDONNELL AND GRUINARD. TODAY THERE IS A SCHOOL BUS WHICH COLLECTS CHILDREN FROM BADLUARACH, DUNDONNELL,BADRALLACH AND CAMUSNAGAUL, SO THERE IS NO CHANCE OF PLAYING ON THE WAY TO SCHOOL. NOWADAYS THE SCHOOL BUS LEAVES BADLUARACH ROAD END AT A QUARTER PAST NINE AND SCHOOL STARTS AT HALF-PAST.
